snippet: The New York Aquarium faced the biggest crisis in its history when Hurricane Sandy hit.
abstract: New York Aquarium in Coney Island, Brooklyn, recovers from crisis during Hurricane Sandy, when flood waters knocked out facility's electrical distribution system, mechanical equipment and critical life support systems for the fish; aquarium is expected to remain closed well into next year, but most of the animals survived the storm.
lead_paragraph: The New York Aquarium faced the biggest crisis in its history when Hurricane Sandy hit.

headline.seo: Hurricane Filled New York Aquarium With Dangerous Substance: Water
